review.title: A Time and Space Efficient Junction Tree Architecture
review.abstract: In this paper we introduce the fast product format, the use of which allows fast computation of a product of many potentials (an operation in the junction tree algorithm (see Shafer, Shenoy: "Probability Propagation")). When combined with the use of the inclusion exclusion format (see Smith, Gogate: "The Inclusion-Exculsion Rule and its Application to the Junction Tree Algorithm") which allows for fast computation of many marginals of a potential, the junction tree algorithm can be made significantly faster in many cases.

metadata.title: Fast Product Format

metadata.abstractText: Preliminaries: Given a set X we define P(X) to be the power set of X (that is, the set of subsets of X) and define |X | to be the cardinality of X (that is, the number of elements in X). A collection is a set that may contain duplicate elements (we use the subset symbol, S ⊆ X , to denote that every element in the collection S is also contained in the set X). This paper assumes we have a alebian group G who’s identity is denoted 1. Given an element a ∈ G we define a to be the inverse element of a. Given elements a, b ∈ G we define ab to be the product of a and b in G. Given a finite collection S ⊆ G we define ∏
